update.title: C++14
update.reason: An upcoming ign-cmake pull request will replace this one.

content.raw: Sounds good, we can deal with this in the future.
content.html: Sounds good, we can deal with this in the future.

content.raw: How about we perform the audit in ign-msgs2? The msgs repo is not on a fixed release schedule, ign-msgs1 will likely never be released into debian, and it's currently blocking development of ign-transport.
content.html: How about we perform the audit in ign-msgs2? The msgs repo is not on a fixed release schedule, ign-msgs1 will likely never be released into debian, and it's currently blocking development of ign-transport.

content.raw:
Maybe we could dedicate a bit of time to audit ign-msgs before making a first major release? Not sure if we have a clear deprecation path for messages, so this could become a pain point as we start using them everywhere.

I've been looking at many of the messages lately and there seem to be outdated fields on many messages. One painful but valuable way to tackle this could be to document all the messages.

Another thing which would be interesting to discuss is syncing up ign-msgs and their corresponding SDF elements. I know they serve different purposes, but I feel that SDF fields have generally been more carefully thought about.
content.html:
Maybe we could dedicate a bit of time to audit ign-msgs before making a first major release? Not sure if we have a clear deprecation path for messages, so this could become a pain point as we start using them everywhere.

I've been looking at many of the messages lately and there seem to be outdated fields on many messages. One painful but valuable way to tackle this could be to document all the messages.

Another thing which would be interesting to discuss is syncing up ign-msgs and their corresponding SDF elements. I know they serve different purposes, but I feel that SDF fields have generally been more carefully thought about.

content.raw:
`c14_scpeters` branch has been merged.

I'll make a release of `ign-msgs1` when this [PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/33) is merged.
content.html:
c14_scpeters branch has been merged.

I'll make a release of ign-msgs1 when this PR is merged.

content.raw: my workspace has `ign-tools` too, and that [brings in c++11](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/src/22d5bada1e363dff1127b9d2acd52728de7c5067/cmake/ignition-config.cmake.in?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ignition-config.cmake.in-14). I have no idea why; that line could probably be deleted
content.html: my workspace has ign-tools too, and that brings in c++11. I have no idea why; that line could probably be deleted

never mind, that got reverted

content.raw: I think we'll need a branch for ign-msgs too, since that's what provides ign-math to ign-transport
content.html: I think we'll need a branch for ign-msgs too, since that's what provides ign-math to ign-transport

content.raw: I think you'll need the c14 branch in ign-math.
content.html: I think you'll need the c14 branch in ign-math.

content.raw: I manually deleted the `-std=c++11` flag, and then it compiled
content.html: I manually deleted the -std=c++11 flag, and then it compiled

content.raw:
I just tried adding a c++14 call, and it fails to compile:

~~~
diff -r 9a11cc5ecd00 src/Discovery_TEST.cc
--- a/src/Discovery_TEST.cc	Tue Aug 15 11:58:47 2017 -0700
+++ b/src/Discovery_TEST.cc	Tue Aug 15 12:17:27 2017 -0700
@@ -391,7 +391,7 @@
   reset();
 
   // Create two discovery nodes.
-  std::unique_ptr<MsgDiscovery> discovery1(new MsgDiscovery(pUuid1, g_msgPort));
+  auto discovery1 = std::make_unique<MsgDiscovery>(pUuid1, g_msgPort);
   MsgDiscovery discovery2(pUuid2, g_msgPort);
 
   // Register one callback for receiving disconnect notifications.
~~~

~~~
/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc: In member function ‘virtual void DiscoveryTest_TestNodeBye_Test::TestBody()’:
/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc:394:21: error: ‘make_unique’ is not a member of ‘std’
   auto discovery1 = std::make_unique<MsgDiscovery>(pUuid1, g_msgPort);
                     ^
/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc:394:50: error: expected primary-expression before ‘>’ token
   auto discovery1 = std::make_unique<MsgDiscovery>(pUuid1, g_msgPort);
                                                  ^
src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/Discovery_TEST.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/Discovery_TEST.cc.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:418: recipe for target 'src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
~~~

I looked at all the compile flags and noticed that it is passing both `-std=c++11` and `-std=c++14`. It is maybe getting the `c++11` flag from ignition-math? Is it a race condition if it gets both flags?

~~~
cd /home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build/src && /usr/lib/ccache/c++    -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/test/gtest/include -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/include -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build/include -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build/test -I/usr/include/uuid -isystem /usr/include/ignition/msgs0 -isystem /usr/include/ignition/math3  -g -O2  -std=c++14 -fvisibility=hidden -Waddress -Warray-bounds -Wcomment -Wformat -Wnonnull -Wparentheses -Wreorder -Wreturn-type -Wsequence-point -Wsign-compare -Wstrict-aliasing -Wstrict-overflow=1 -Wswitch -Wtrigraphs -Wuninitialized -Wunused-function -Wunused-label -Wunused-value -Wunused-variable -Wvolatile-register-var -Wextra -Wno-long-long -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wfloat-equal -Wshadow -Winit-self -Wswitch-default -Wmissing-include-dirs -pedantic -Wno-pragmas -Wc++14-compat  -g -O2    -fPIC -std=c++11 -o CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/Discovery_TEST.cc.o -c /home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc

~~~
content.html:
I just tried adding a c++14 call, and it fails to compile:

diff -r 9a11cc5ecd00 src/Discovery_TEST.cc
--- a/src/Discovery_TEST.cc Tue Aug 15 11:58:47 2017 -0700
+++ b/src/Discovery_TEST.cc Tue Aug 15 12:17:27 2017 -0700
@@ -391,7 +391,7 @@
   reset();

   // Create two discovery nodes.
-  std::unique_ptr<MsgDiscovery> discovery1(new MsgDiscovery(pUuid1, g_msgPort));
+  auto discovery1 = std::make_unique<MsgDiscovery>(pUuid1, g_msgPort);
   MsgDiscovery discovery2(pUuid2, g_msgPort);

   // Register one callback for receiving disconnect notifications.

/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc: In member function ‘virtual void DiscoveryTest_TestNodeBye_Test::TestBody()’:
/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc:394:21: error: ‘make_unique’ is not a member of ‘std’
   auto discovery1 = std::make_unique<MsgDiscovery>(pUuid1, g_msgPort);
                     ^
/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc:394:50: error: expected primary-expression before ‘>’ token
   auto discovery1 = std::make_unique<MsgDiscovery>(pUuid1, g_msgPort);
                                                  ^
src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/Discovery_TEST.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/Discovery_TEST.cc.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:418: recipe for target 'src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....

I looked at all the compile flags and noticed that it is passing both -std=c++11 and -std=c++14. It is maybe getting the c++11 flag from ignition-math? Is it a race condition if it gets both flags?

cd /home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build/src && /usr/lib/ccache/c++    -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/test/gtest/include -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/include -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build/include -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build -I/home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/build/test -I/usr/include/uuid -isystem /usr/include/ignition/msgs0 -isystem /usr/include/ignition/math3  -g -O2  -std=c++14 -fvisibility=hidden -Waddress -Warray-bounds -Wcomment -Wformat -Wnonnull -Wparentheses -Wreorder -Wreturn-type -Wsequence-point -Wsign-compare -Wstrict-aliasing -Wstrict-overflow=1 -Wswitch -Wtrigraphs -Wuninitialized -Wunused-function -Wunused-label -Wunused-value -Wunused-variable -Wvolatile-register-var -Wextra -Wno-long-long -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wfloat-equal -Wshadow -Winit-self -Wswitch-default -Wmissing-include-dirs -pedantic -Wno-pragmas -Wc++14-compat  -g -O2    -fPIC -std=c++11 -o CMakeFiles/UNIT_Discovery_TEST.dir/Discovery_TEST.cc.o -c /home/scpeters/ws_old/ignition/src/ign-transport/src/Discovery_TEST.cc

content.raw: So I think ignition-transport4 will not work on trusty; that caused the bitbucket pipeline to fail (I think that's fine though). This might require some additional work to make Windows happy too.
content.html: So I think ignition-transport4 will not work on trusty; that caused the bitbucket pipeline to fail (I think that's fine though). This might require some additional work to make Windows happy too.
